area_name: Miles Of Piles Rock - West Face

climbs.name: Winds of Whoopee
climbs.fa: Rob Raker, Perry Beckham & Randy Vogel, January 1984

content.description:
Start left of a large tree. Stiff, thin moves right from the start lead to a stance below a roof. Jam through the roof (crux) and head left into a wider crack. Fist jams in the wide section lead up and out.

While I'm told that many feel the roof is the crux, the starting moves cannot be ignored.  This climb has something for all hand sizes and should not be missed.

The descent is the only negative about this route.  Descend via the climber's left. Loosen your shoes for the jump, your toes will thank you!
content.protection: Good gear distribution as the climb starts thin and goes through just about all sizes.

climbs.name: Winds of Change
climbs.fa: Dan Hirshman (TR), Paul Borne, Dave Mayville, Dave Bengston 1991 (Lead)

content.description: This is yet another slightly overhanging stemming/chimneying crack climb on the West Face of Miles of Piles Rock.  Technical and high quality moves, but you need to work for the gear.
content.protection: Pants help your knees.  Extra thin/small nuts and cams with a design like Aliens or Metolius Master Cams help near the end.  Gear belay, tie off blocks, nuts, small cams.
content.location: This route is left of Winds of Woopee and right of Flaring Rhoid.  From the summit, down climb a chimney to the southwest, hard and ugly.

climbs.name: Making Wind
climbs.fa: Dan Hirshman (TR), Dave Mayville, Paul Borne, Dave Bengston, 1991 (Lead)

content.description: This climb isn't so bad except for the loose grainy rock.  Chimney up with finger sized cracks for gear.
content.protection: Wear pants or something on your knees, small stoppers and tiny/small cams.  Nothing larger than 2".  Gear belay on blocks, stoppers or small/medium cams.
content.location:
This route is the obvious chimney with two parallel cracks on the left side of the west face of Miles of Piles Rock.

Climb over the summit south then down climb a loose chimney west back to the pack.  The descent is no fun.

content.description: This is a fun route with good, slightly overhanging jamming.  The rock is pretty good and there is a lot of gear.
content.protection: A standard rack of stoppers and cams to 4".  Gear anchor - tie off blocks, stoppers, small cams.  Descend by going to the summit and then down climbing a chimney to the southwest, no fun.
content.location: This route is right of Making Wind and left of Winds of Change on the West Face of Miles of Piles Rock.  Start by climbing the first 5 feet of Making Wind and traverse right to start this route.

pathTokens: Miles Of Piles Rock - West Face
